# WhatsApp Bot MVP â€” Overview & Next Steps

## âœ… Summary

This project is a self-hosted WhatsApp bot built in TypeScript using Baileys, SQLite, and a lightweight scheduler. It can:

- Connect to WhatsApp as a real user
- Schedule one-time or recurring messages
- Wake up periodically (cron-style) to send pending messages
- Easily be extended with future message handlers

All files live in a simple `src/` directory, with SQLite for persistence. No Puppeteer/Chromium needed.

## âœ… What Works Now

- Bot starts and connects via WhatsApp Web (QR shown on first run)
- Scheduled messages stored in SQLite and sent on time
- Recurring weekly messages matched by weekday/hour/minute
- Basic event handler scaffolding for future features:
  - `handleMessage`
  - `handleReaction`
  - `handleChatUpdate`
- Dev runs via `bun run src/index.ts` or `ts-node`

## ğŸ“Œ Technical Notes

- âœ… Baileys is used for direct WebSocket communication with WhatsApp Web. No Puppeteer/Chromium required.
- âœ… Auth persistence is handled via Baileys' `useMultiFileAuthState`, which saves QR session data in `/auth`.
- âœ… `scheduled_messages` and `recurring_messages` tables are stored in a local SQLite file (`bot.sqlite`) for simplicity and portability.
- âœ… Scheduled message loop runs every minute via `node-cron`, pulling pending jobs and sending them using `sock.sendMessage(chatId, { text })`.
- âœ… `recurring_messages` are matched by (weekday, hour, minute) and deduplicated using a `lastSent` timestamp to avoid double sends.
- âœ… Event stubs (`handleMessage`, `handleReaction`, `handleChatUpdate`) are wired up for future use inside `whatsapp.ts`.
- ğŸ§ª Development is designed to run with Bun or Node, and no Docker is required for MVP.
